conclusion: The circuit consists of a rotating rectangular coil connected to a resistance R via slip rings, and the AC voltmeter measures the alternating current generated by the generator.
The magnetic flux Φ through each turn of the coil is sinusoidal, with Φ = 2 × 10^-2 Wb at t = 0.
The maximum flux occurs when the magnetic field is at its maximum, which is when the magnetic flux is at its maximum value of 2 × 10^-2 Wb.
The EMF is given by the derivative of the flux with respect to time. Since the flux is sinusoidal, the EMF is also sinusoidal.
The maximum EMF occurs when the flux is at its maximum, which is 2 × 10^-2 Wb. The derivative of this flux with respect to time is 2 × 10^-2 Wb/s.
Since the EMF is measured in volts, convert it to the maximum value of the alternating current. The maximum value of the alternating current is 2 × 10^-2 A.
The maximum value of the EMF is consistent with the sinusoidal nature of the flux, and the calculation matches the given values.
